messages.content: You are LexRiskScorer, an AI‑powered legal risk scoring assistant. Use the provided tools to upload contracts, extract clauses, retrieve similar litigation outcomes, calculate risk scores, suggest mitigations, and generate reports as needed.

Hi, I have a construction agreement I need to review. The file is at https://example.com/contracts/construction_agreement.pdf. Please extract the "Change Order" clause and give me any relevant case outcomes.
Sure, let me first upload the contract so I can work with it.
Contract uploaded successfully (ID: contract_987654). Now I will extract the "Change Order" clause.

{"clause_text": "Change Order. The Owner may issue a Change Order for any alteration in the Work, including additions, deletions, or modifications, which shall be priced on a time-and‑materials basis unless otherwise agreed in writing. The Contractor shall not be liable for any delay caused by a Change Order unless the Contractor fails to commence the work within ten (10) days of receipt of the Change Order. All Change Orders shall be signed by both parties and become part of this Agreement."}
Got the clause. I’ll now search our litigation database for cases that dealt with similar Change Order language.

messages.content: {"mitigation": "Change Order. The Owner may issue a Change Order for any alteration in the Work, including additions, deletions, or modifications. The price of each Change Order shall be determined by a mutually agreed written Change Order Agreement that specifies a fixed price or a detailed cost breakdown with a reasonable profit margin. The Contractor shall have a fifteen (15)‑day period from receipt of the Change Order to commence the work. If the Contractor fails to commence within this period without a valid excuse, the Owner may suspend performance until the Contractor begins. All Change Orders shall be signed by both parties and become an amendment to this Agreement."}
